top_20_results.content: Ductal disease is a broad group encompassing both benign and malignant entities which may overlap clinically and radiologically. Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) is a noninvasive breast malignancy accounting for 20% of newly diagnosed breast cancer cases. It involves malignant epithelial cells confined to the duct(s).
